comments.body: If nether update is a update to the NETHER then why does they would add a snowier snow in the nether update? It should be to Mountains Update.
It seems, from what we could see at the Minecraft Live, that moss will come into the new caves. But I would really appreciate to see it on trees and logs in deep forests.
How about giving a more moist/wet posing noise to the moss blocks ?
Tipped arrows do this just fine.
Interesting idea, although there are harming arrows.

I was going to make a post on this. I think the iron, gold, and diamond arrows should have decreased range with iron having the least range decreased and diamond arrows being the most decreased. Crafting these arrows (and also maybe tipped arrows) should be able to be done in the fletching table to give it a use as well. If you use a crossbow for either the iron, gold, or diamond arrows, their range won't be decreased and will be the same as using a regular arrow and a crossbow if you shoot these special arrows with a crossbow.
would give a use to fletching tables if you upgraded/ crafted different arrows. and potion tipped ones could be even more powerfull
Great idea! but this is most likely already suggested.
Yes good idea, i think it would be obtainable by killing evokers or some rare mob, obviously it would have a rare chance, like 6%?
Totem of undropping maybe
I think it would be overpowered to be able to save your whole inventory. Maybe an enchantment for individual items would be more fair.
the totem of undying kind of already does that

Oh yeah! Like the totem of undying keeps you from dying, a totem of keep inventory will keep your inventory from falling in lava or something. And like the totem, it should only be found in loot chests.
I think the item should also disappear when you die, so it isnt overpowered.

Well, the totem of holding from quark allows your items to all be put in a totem of holding, and kept in place where you died (no special item required), or you could make a personal rule to yourself, have a specific item and if you have it you can have keepinventory turned on

-Armor
-Gold-
-1- 1 piece of gold infused armor will increase the players speed by 2%
-2- Each piece of gold infused armor will decrease the amount of damage the player takes by 3%, while the armor takes 10% more damage
-Iron- Increased durability
-Diamond- Increased durability+Slight protection boost
-Emerald-
-1- Each piece of emerald infused armor, has a 1% chance of completely avoiding an attack of any sort.
-2- Each piece of emerald infused armor decreases hunger by 4%

-Fishing rod
-Gold- Reduces the wait for a fish to bite by 1 second
-Iron- Increased durability
-Diamond- Increased Durability along with a reduced wait time (-.5 seconds)
-Emerald-
-1- 50% Increased chance to get salmon instead of cod, clown fish, pufferfish, and garbage.
-2- A color can glimmer when the "fish" is approaching the stick, that tells the player what they are about to get. White means fish/Garbage. Green means saddle/Nametag. Red means enchanted book. Yellow means enchanted rod/bow.

-Sheers
-Gold- higher chance to receive more wool from a sheep. (7.5%)
-iron- Increased durability
-diamond- Increased durability+higher chance to receive more wool from sheep. (4%)
-Emerald- When a sheep is sheared with emerald infused sheers, the sheep increases the chance of regrowing it's fur by 10%

It's just an idea but I think it would be really really cool. Also it's all adjustable so if you think something is too OP, then Nerf it, and vise versa.

Another Idea I had was that there could be like an end stone ore block, and in order for you to fuse something, you would need end ore (Like lapis in an enchantment table) and based on what mineral you fuse, it would determine the amount of end ore used.

Emerald=3 end ore

Iron=1 End ore

Also you could make blocks of of end ore like nether quartz

I like the idea of upgrading armour/tools but I think it should only use more unique materials.

Some examples could be:
Emerald: one damage/protection,
Spider eye: poison/poison resistance,
Wither bones: wither/wither resistance,
Magma cream: auto smelt/fire variant of thorns,
Puffer fish: nausea/nausea resistance,
Zombie flesh: hunger/hunger resistance.

These effects would be weak but useful.
You should only be able to forge one item into your tool so it isn't over powered, and I don't think the improvement should ever go away unless it is put in a grindstone, otherwise it would be annoying, always haven to reforge your stuff.

I think instead of each tool being able to fuse with each material, each tool should have its own exclusive fusion material that entirely changes the name of the tool, as well as enhances the tool
Diamond tool/armour + netherite ingot = netherite tool/armour (+ durability, + armour toughness, + knock back resistance, + damage, + enchant ability)
Gold tool/armour + Lapis lazuli = Lapis tool/armour (+enchant ability)
Iron tool/armour + coal = steel tool/armour (+durability, + knock back resistance, + damage, - enchant ability)
Stone/wood tool + string = makeshift stone/wood tool (+durability)
Chain mail is fine how it is
Leather armour + wool = studded armour (+ knockback resistance)

Combine armour with other materials/items to grant them unique buffs or abilities. A totem, granting the armour 1x use of the totem ability, a netherstar to make it be bound to your player for 1x on death, and maybe others. I very much agree with the other suggestions in this thread being able to combine different types of materials with armour changing it into a completely new type with unique properties. The smithing table could offer custamizable tools, weapons and armour, adding massive amounts of content to the game.
i like this idea and i was thnkng that lapis could add a 25% bonus on the strength of any encharntment. meansng that unbreaking III would be 25% better?

Endorite recipes: Endorite block, full endorite armour and tools (better than diamond), endorite observer (observer recipe but all cobblestone replaced with endorite) able to detect entities), endorite  pressure plate (only powers when walked on by a player), endorite block stairs and slabs, endorite dust (black dye), endorite weather sensor(three settings, clear weather,rainy weather, and thunder storm), and endorite torch(can be dyed to any color of texture and light).
There should also be endorite boats, able to go on lava and water
Whoa, I like the recipes, but the full tools that are better than diamond? This ore is as common as Nether quartz. I would ditch the tools, but the armor is a good idea.
There IS a reason to go to the end-fighting the ender dragon, getting shulker shells, elytra...
yes, but after you get those things there's no other reason to go to the end EVER unless you just want to see it. or you lost your elytra
Short, sweet, and simply written - good luck with your efforts!
You can place banners on walls at 1 block and they will be 1 block tall.
I agree!
I would love mangos in minecraft and what if you could tame gorillas with them
It would be helpful for moving a base without any of resources from other dimensions
Yeah! This would make my world so much more fun, because I have storage problems!

I always have this issue when I am in friends servers because we start off somewhere close to spawn and then we just spread out further. And at this stage, we are still rather early in terms of progress because no one has gone to the end let alone found a nether portal so having something like the barrel to be used as a way of storing items would be amazing!
So true because the creepers are destroying my storage room! I like your idea.
Perhaps barrels should be able to be pushed by pistons, rather than have them be like shulker boxes with less space
I think this is cool cus Im not really good at minecraft so i can use this as a shulker box and not need to fight the enderdragon and stuff

Yes, just yes.

 

 

Also please tell me there's a mod like this because that would be /very helpful
I like the idea of the smithing table upgrading any sword to a greatsword by inserting it with the corresponding material.

For a smithing table, a "outline" would also be appropriate, like a "flag pattern" on a loom. A variety of blueprints for weapons, tools, armor, and other metal items can be found in structures or purchased.

We can tell you put in a lot of thought for this idea and appreciate your efforts! Some of what you have mentioned in here already has an existing discussion about it, so please do a search and lend your ideas, discussion, and possible support to those if appropriate.As a helpful piece of advice, lists like this tend to not fall under items your community team can take to our developers because we can't tell what exactly people are voting for. Feel free to repost your ideas in their own posts!

Be sure to check existing ideas before reposting. The Search box is located on every single page of the Feedback site. Just enter a word or two about the topic you want to post about and hit return. You may want to try alternate or common misspellings! It's amazing what you can find with one word.

Thank you!

I love the ideas I think instead of sticks two iron like a torch can craft two iron handles/sticks for the tools. Also I think and obsidian shield could be cool too. This shield will have double the protection as a normal shield or at least be fire proof to blaze, ghast, and bows and swords with flame.

So one, i think that sometimes obsidian dropping an obsidian gem would be better than the blast furnace idea and 2 i think that obsidian armor / tools would be awesome but really expensive because it could only be defeated by diamond+ pickaxe, and it would be like a blackish color with the texture of netherite.
Call it a steamboat.
As much as would love this to be in game it can't be because the fire from the furnace would burn down the boat seeing that it's made out of wood.
No it would burn the boat fire would be contained in the furnace. With it in the boat the furnace could be need a little to if needed
How about a regular furnace instead
I think the Furnace should be at the back like a engine and it should only be able to hold one person
It is an excellent idea, especially when they announced chests in a boat. But what about regular furnaces on the back?
I think you should be able to place it inside of the boat and take it out so the boat would move forwards automatically and you can fuel it with coal.
What if there were 3 tiers, (boat, boat w/furnace, boat w/blast furnace) A decent weakness could be that when powered, it will keep going until it crashes, is destroyed, or runs out of fuel.
Ooooo. I like it.

It does seem strange that you can turn string into wool, but can't turn wool into string considering that IRL the opposite is basically true. Some may think that would make it too easy to get string, but the biggest need is to be able to make bows for dispensers. Unless you build a big mob farm it can be hard to get enough string for some complex builds, and in peaceful mode there are few ways to get string at all.
I think it is a great idea because it will give more functions to the loom. Some of the new tables seems to not be that useful so giving them more uses Will make them more necesary for the game.
This makes sense, and would be useful.

This is crucial. The string-to-wool craft was a fantastic idea. It made biomes without sheep more survivable, because you could craft wool from string and thus make a bed even though there were no sheep. The problem is, with 1.18 the new mob spawn rules have made spiders A LOT rarer. Consequently STRING is a lot rarer, and string is necessary for bows, crossbows, fishing poles, and scaffolding. Making the string-to-wool craft reversible, possibly using the loom, would mitigate the problem of string becoming rarer.
Would love these. Scaffolding is awesome, but to make a lot of them you currently basically have to find a spider spawner.

This would be a nice edition to Minecraft. I've been using leads as a way to make ropes in wells, but that means there's an animal stuck at the bottom of the well! That's animal cruelty! (Bedrock Player)
Great idea that needs to be noticed
I love the idea, I am also a big medieval builder by myself
With the addition of Chain Blocks, I see this as a big possibility to come up soon
Mending would also work, I like this idea and this would also slow for a more nomadic lifestyle.
I like this idea but I think it's not intuitive to press jump. I would prefer a left or right click
I was gonna Make a suggestion the was exactly like this and i foun this,
How and why does this not exist yet??
They should also add the rope where it connects two people would be dope
Instead of climbing as if you where in a ladder I think you should press right click to hang from the edge of a block which has no blocks above, then press jump to climb that block

Minecraft is about 10 years now and we see that games like botw and others recently have been using wall climbing to let the inexperienced players go wherever they want easily and I feel like it's about time for Minecraft to give these players some benifit since they tend to appeal to the casual audience and it can also give the more hardcore fans more in depth mechanics to game too. Everyone wins here

Also makes ender dragon much easier too

Emeralds are already a currency that functions well in the game. The coins and minebucks just would certainly add something new to the game, but nothing necessary. You mentioned Item Shops but didn't go in depth about how they work or how they'd be better than trading normally with Villagers. In history, the Bronze Age came before the Iron Age, so why would bronze be better than iron? Also bronze is an alloy of copper and zinc, so it does not form naturally as an ore.
Coins are made from copper so they should make a copper ore for making coins
cool idea... VOTED!!!   :-)
More uses for slime blocks. Voted.
Yes. Also stew and soup.
i think it should fill your saturation more than cooked food variants, that would make it fair

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain why this is a good idea or what they'd be used for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

 

Also, I moved it to the right category.

Yes! Please make this happen. It would be wonderful. :D

See screenshot for why non-waterlogged leaves look bad. Waterlogging leaves would be great for helping with underwater builds which use leaves for various aesthetic purposes.
i am also for this, because i have been building with leaves underwater, and they do look kinda goofy with the water layered on top of them
Would they go on a new tree, a bush, or how would they be found? Would they drop a dead tree sapling so you can grow more?
Why?
why not.
Very nice idea and textures, but I think we should have a discussion like this before thinking about adding new foods. Voted nonetheless.
Nice artwork, great concept, and even though I absolutely HATE lentil soup in real life, I like the idea! But no offense to the lentils lovers out there XD.
How do you create the images like lentil soup, which btw is a good idea.
Temperature effected water? I like that! Cold water could give you the freezing effect along with making it harder to hold your breathe, very hot water could hurt you slowly and also mess with vision
Too op.
Terrible idea.
Yes like fire residence armor
